revised_title: Investigating the Chemical Changes and Efficiency in the Planté Lead-Sulphuric Acid-Lead Peroxide Cell
tldr: The authors study the Planté lead-sulphuric acid-lead peroxide cell and conclude that the cooling effect is due to the dissociation of dilute sulphuric acid. They also find that the loss of efficiency is caused by the formation of peroxides in the electrolyte and excessive sulphating at the peroxide plate in the local circuit.
